General McClellan focused so intently on the petty, logistical details of the upcoming campaign that Lincoln felt that said attention to _________, however necessary, had superseded more lofty goals.
Blank (i)
(A) irrelevancies
(B) tactics
(C) minutiae
(D) strategy
(E) peccadilloes
